text: Has there been a fix for SNI to work with ie8 on windows xp?
creator: jsanchez@opsource.net

text:
These are codes from each browser:

Unfortunately, your client [Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 5.1; Trident/4.0; .NET CLR 1.1.4322; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.0.4506.2152; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET4.0C; .NET4.0E)] did not send a TLS server name indication extension (RFC 4366) in its ClientHello (negotiated protocol: TLSv1), so you're probably getting warnings about certificate name mismatches.

text: This is not a problem in httpd but in the SSL/TLS libraries of Windows XP. AFAIK, there has not been any update by microsoft.
